item.title: Arvind Kejriwal Targets BJP, Congress As LG Orders Probe Into AAP's Delhi Welfare Schemes - News18
item.description:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP and Congress Amid Probe Into AAP Welfare Schemes

Date: December 28, 2024

Source: News18

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Arvind Kejriwal accused the BJP of pressuring Congress to file complaints against AAP’s welfare initiatives. Kejriwal responded to complaints regarding the 'Mahila Samman' scheme, which purportedly supports women in Delhi.

  • Dikshit alleged fraud related to AAP’s welfare schemes.
  • Kejriwal stated BJP is distributing money openly without scrutiny.
  • The AAP aims to push for the Congress’ expulsion from the INDIA bloc if they don’t act against party leaders.
  • Public notices were issued distancing government departments from AAP's promised schemes.
“BJP leaders are openly distributing money, but no one will investigate that.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The latest developments indicate increasing tensions among major political parties in Delhi as the elections approach, with AAP facing accusations from both BJP and Congress regarding its welfare programs.

item.title: At Manmohan Singh's last rites, BJP in limelight, Congress complains of being put in shadows - ThePrint
item.description:
At Manmohan Singh's Last Rites, BJP in Limelight, Congress Complains of Being Put in Shadows

Date: December 28, 2024   Source: ThePrint

The funeral of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh saw prominent political figures present, but the Congress party expressed grievances about their representation during the event.

  • Rahul Gandhi and senior Congress leaders carried the casket during the funeral procession.
  • High-profile attendees included Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the King of Bhutan.
  • Only Doordarshan cameras were permitted in to cover the funeral, which Congress criticized as a mismanagement.
  • Congress leaders claimed their party received limited visibility in media coverage.
  • Accusations from Congress included claims of disrespect shown to Singh's family during the state funeral.
The PM did not stand when the King of Bhutan stood. - Pawan Khera

The Congress party's response emphasizes a need for acknowledgment and respect for their leaders, alleging that media controls favored the ruling party.

item.title: ‘Forcible evacuation’ of fasting farmer leader will lead to ‘collateral damage’: Punjab to Supreme Court - The Hindu
item.description:
Punjab Government Cautions Supreme Court on Forcible Evacuation of Farmer Leader

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Punjab government warned the Supreme Court that forcibly evacuating farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a hunger strike, could lead to serious repercussions for both police and the protesting farmers.

  • Dallewal has been fasting at the Khanauri border since November 26, demanding legal guarantees for minimum support prices (MSP) for crops.
  • The Supreme Court suggested that the situation could be de-escalated with intervention from the Centre.
  • 3,000 people are gathered at the protest site, creating a strong resistance against any attempts to evacuate Dallewal.
  • The court has given the Punjab government more time to comply with hospitalisation orders for Dallewal.
“What is the Centre doing to defuse the situation? Are you doing something?” - Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia

The ongoing dispute highlights the intense standoff between the farmers and the government, stressing the urgent need for engagement to avoid further escalations.

item.title: On Congress Attacks Over Manmohan Singh Funeral, JP Nadda's 'Super PM' Swipe - NDTV
item.description:
On Congress Attacks Over Manmohan Singh Funeral, JP Nadda's 'Super PM' Swipe

Date: New Delhi
Source: News Article

Following the cremation of former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, Congress leaders Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi criticized the BJP for 'insulting' his memory. BJP President JP Nadda accused Congress of playing 'cheap politics' regarding the former PM's funeral arrangements.

  • Dr. Singh was cremated with full state honours at Nigambodh Ghat in Delhi.
  • Congress demanded a memorial site befitting Dr. Singh's stature, which they believe was not honored by the BJP.
  • Rahul Gandhi stated the BJP 'totally insulted' Dr. Singh by choosing the cremation site.
  • JP Nadda defended the government's decisions, arguing that space for a memorial would be allocated.
  • The controversy highlights ongoing political tensions surrounding the legacy of Manmohan Singh.
Rahul Gandhi: "Dr Manmohan Singh deserves our highest respect and a memorial. The government should have shown respect..."

The incident reflects the deep political divide in India regarding the reverence shown to former leaders, particularly in the context of the late Dr. Singh's legacy.

item.title: ‘Heartening to see Kashmiris open homes to stranded’: As temperature plummets in Valley, tales of warmth - The Indian Express
item.description:
Kashmiris Open Homes to Stranded Tourists Amid Heavy Snowfall

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: The Indian Express

The early snowfall in Kashmir has resulted in unexpected warmth from locals, who are opening their homes and mosques to assist stranded tourists and residents as heavy snow made roads impassable.

  • Hundreds of tourists stranded due to heavy snowfall on the Srinagar-Jammu highway.
  • Locals opened homes and mosques to provide shelter and warmth to those affected.
  • About 1,000 tourists accommodated in Gund, with women and children sheltered in homes and men in the Jamia Masjid.
  • The snowfall was significant, with eight inches recorded in Srinagar and up to two feet in some southern areas.
  • The heavy snow led to power outages and road closures, with authorities working to restore services.
“Heartening to see Kashmiris opening their masjids and homes to stranded tourists amidst heavy snowfall.” - Mirwaiz Umar Farooq

This event highlights the spirit of hospitality in Kashmir as the community rallies to support those in need during severe weather conditions.

item.title: Modi government ‘insulted’ Manmohan Singh by cremating him at Nigambodh Ghat, charges Congress - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Accuses Modi Government of Insulting Manmohan Singh's Legacy

Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The leader of the Opposition, Rahul Gandhi, criticized the Modi government for allegedly insulting former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh by not allocating a dedicated memorial site for his last rites.

  • After Dr. Singh's funeral, Congress expressed outrage over the lack of a designated place for his cremation.
  • Gandhi emphasized the need for respect regarding the funerals of past prime ministers.
  • Congress leaders accused the government of disrespectful management during the funeral.
“The great son of Mother India and the first Prime Minister of the Sikh community, Dr. Manmohan Singh ji has been totally insulted by the present government…” - Rahul Gandhi

In conclusion, the controversy surrounding Singh's cremation highlights ongoing political tensions over the treatment of former leaders.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: BJP is trying to politicise a suicide: Karnataka Priyank kharge on suicide of contractor - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Priyank Kharge Accuses BJP of Politicizing Contractor's Suicide in Karnataka

Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge criticized the BJP for allegedly politicizing the suicide of a contractor in Bidar, emphasizing the need for an impartial investigation into the incident.

  • Priyank Kharge claimed the BJP is using the contractor's suicide for political gains.
  • Kharge requests a thorough inquiry into both the contractor's and the accused's perspectives.
  • BJP President BY Vijayendra Yediyurappa accused Kharge's aide of harassment leading to the contractor's suicide.
"It's very clear that BJP is trying to politicise a suicide by a contractor." - Priyank Kharge

The incident has sparked a heated political debate, emphasizing the need for a fair investigation into the circumstances surrounding the tragedy.

item.title: ‘Deceptive politics’: BJP slams Rahul Gandhi over X post on Manmohan Singh - Hindustan Times
item.description:
BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi Over Comments on Manmohan Singh's Funeral

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has rebuffed Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's accusations of disrespecting former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh following Singh's funeral at Nigambodh Ghat, a public cremation site.

  • The BJP criticized Gandhi for “politicizing” Singh's death.
  • Gandhi stated Singh was insulted by conducting his last rites in a public location.
  • The Congress party has called for a memorial to honor Singh's legacy.
“The kind of deceptive politics Congress has engaged in... is unfortunate.” - BJP MP Sambit Patra

The BJP assured that a memorial will be constructed in remembrance of Singh, while Congress continues to contest the location of his cremation.

item.title: Passengers Stranded In Mumbai As Flight Delayed For 16 Hours, IndiGo Responds - NDTV
item.description:
Passengers Stranded In Mumbai As Flight Delayed For 16 Hours, IndiGo Responds

Date: Recent

Source: Not specified

At least 100 Istanbul-bound passengers of an IndiGo flight are stranded at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport due to a 16-hour delay caused by a technical glitch.

  • Flight 6E17 was scheduled to depart at 6:55am but is now set to take off at 11pm after multiple delays.
  • IndiGo has arranged an alternative aircraft and apologized for the inconvenience.
  • Passengers staged protests at the airport demanding refunds or alternative travel arrangements.
  • Several passengers voiced complaints on social media regarding the airline's handling of the situation.
“We regret that our flight 6E17... faced a delay due to technical issues.” - IndiGo
“The staff is extremely rude and refuse to answer any questions...” - Sonam Saigal

This incident highlights the frustrations faced by air travelers during unexpected delays and the need for better communication from airlines.

item.title: ‘Totally insulted by the present government’: Rahul Gandhi on Manmohan Singh’s cremation - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Totally insulted by the present government’: Rahul Gandhi on Manmohan Singh’s cremation

Publication Date: 2023-10-25 Source: Times of India

Rahul Gandhi expressed his discontent with the current government during the cremation of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, condemning the lack of respect shown towards him.

  • Rahul Gandhi spoke about the importance of acknowledging contributions of leaders like Singh.
  • Comments reflect a broader critique of the government's treatment of former officials.
  • The remarks were made in a public setting during the cremation ceremony.
“It is totally insulting the way this government has treated Manmohan Singh.”

This incident underscores ongoing tensions between political leaders regarding the legacy and treatment of former Prime Ministers in India.

item.title: Labourer killed, actor Urmila Kothare injured in horrific accident in Mumbai - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Actor Urmila Kothare's Car Runs Over Labourers in Mumbai, 1 Killed

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In a tragic incident in Kandivali, Mumbai, actress Urmila Kothare's car lost control and hit two Metro workers, resulting in one death and another serious injury.

  • The accident occurred while Kothare was returning from work near Poisar Metro station.
  • One labourer died on the spot, while the other sustained severe injuries.
  • Both the actress and her driver suffered minor injuries due to airbags deploying.
  • The police have filed a case against the driver and initiated an investigation.
“Urmila Kothare's car hit two labourers who were engaged in Metro rail work under the Poisar Metro station…” - Police Official

The incident has raised concerns about road safety, particularly following other recent accidents in Mumbai. An investigation is underway to determine the cause.

item.title: Former PM Manmohan Singh cremated with full state honours at Nigambodh Ghat - The Hindu
item.description:
Former PM Manmohan Singh Cremated with Full State Honours at Nigambodh Ghat

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh was cremated with full state honours on December 28, 2024, attended by numerous dignitaries from India and abroad. His funeral pyre was lit by his daughter, Upinder Singh, amidst religious hymns.

  • President Droupadi Murmu led the nation in paying respects.
  • Security forces fired three volleys as a mark of honour.
  • Numerous political leaders, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi and former Congress leaders, attended.
  • Dr. Singh’s final journey started from his official residence and included a procession to the AICC headquarters.
  • A national mourning period of seven days has been declared with flags at half-mast.
“As long as the sun and moon remain, your name will remain.”

Dr. Singh, aged 92, passed away due to age-related complications, and his contributions to India's economic reforms are widely acknowledged.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal accuses BJP of blocking welfare schemes in Delhi, vows to implement Mahila Samman and San - The Times of India
item.description:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Hindering Welfare in Delhi

Published on: [Insert Date]  |  Source: [Insert Source]

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has accused the BJP of obstructing welfare schemes intended for the people of Delhi. He expressed his commitment to implement essential programs like Mahila Samman and Sanjeevani Yojana.

  • Kejriwal claims BJP is blocking crucial welfare initiatives.
  • He vows to implement Mahila Samman and Sanjeevani Yojana regardless of opposition.
  • The Chief Minister emphasizes the importance of these schemes for women's empowerment and health.
“We will not let the BJP obstruct our efforts for the welfare of the people,” said Kejriwal.

This conflict highlights ongoing political tensions in Delhi and the ongoing struggle for social welfare amidst governmental opposition.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal Slams BJP Over Blockage of Welfare Schemes in Delhi - The Times of India
item.description:
Arvind Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Hindering Welfare Schemes in Delhi

Published on: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has publicly accused the BJP of obstructing welfare schemes aimed at empowering women and enhancing healthcare services in Delhi. He pledged to implement a new Mahila Samman scheme and the Sanjeevani Yojana.

  • Kejriwal claims that the BJP is blocking the execution of essential welfare programs.
  • The Mahila Samman initiative focuses on women's economic and social empowerment.
  • The Sanjeevani Yojana aims to strengthen healthcare services across Delhi.
“The BJP is not allowing the government to deliver welfare services to the people of Delhi,” said Kejriwal.

This confrontation highlights the ongoing political tensions between the AAP and the BJP in Delhi.

item.title: Anna University sexual assault case: Madras High Court says IPS officers team, comprising women only, to probe Chennai sexual assault case - The Hindu
item.description:
Madras High Court Forms Women-Only Team to Investigate Anna University Sexual Assault

Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Madras High Court has constituted an all-woman team of IPS officers to investigate the sexual assault of a student at Anna University, along with the leak of the FIR related to the case.

  • The court ordered a Special Investigation Team (SIT) including IPS officers Bhukya Sneha Priya, Ayman Jamal, and S. Brinda.
  • The Tamil Nadu government consented to the formation of the SIT.
  • The court mandated the state to pay ₹25 lakh in compensation to the survivor.
  • It was stated that the university should not collect any fees from the survivor and must provide necessary counseling and assistance.
  • The court directed the government to consider action against the Greater Chennai Commissioner of Police for revealing investigation details prematurely.
  • The judges criticized the wording of the FIR which led to victim-shaming.
  • A technical glitch was cited as the reason for the leak of the FIR.
“When the Constitution does not discriminate between men and women, society cannot dictate how women should conduct themselves.”

The Madras High Court's decision to form an all-women team signifies a step towards ensuring sensitive handling of sexual assault cases in India.

item.title: Exclusive | Anupam Kher on row with Hansal Mehta over film on Manmohan Singh: He can't abandon a ship if its sinking - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Anupam Kher, who essayed the late Manmohan Singh, feels Hansal Mehta shouldn't participate in bringing down their 2019 film The Accidental Prime Minister

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Anupam Kher expresses his discomfort with Hansal Mehta's criticism of their film, 'The Accidental Prime Minister,' urging him to take ownership of his work.

  • Kher stands by the film, calling it one of his best works.
  • He criticizes Mehta for agreeing with negative comments about the film.
  • Kher insists that Mehta, as a Creative Director, should not abandon the film even if it faces criticism.
  • Mehta previously endorsed a tweet criticizing the film, which upset Kher.
“You cannot abandon the ship. You own up your work.” - Anupam Kher

Kher emphasizes the importance of ownership in filmmaking and expresses that criticism of the film so long after its release is in bad taste.

item.title: 'Unheard Of': Supreme Court On Farmers Gathering To Resist Shifting Of Farmers Leader Dallewal; Seeks... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Voices Concerns Over Farmers' Leader's Health Amid Standoff

Date: December 28, 2023

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has expressed dissatisfaction with the Punjab government's compliance report regarding the health of farmers' leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who has been on a hunger strike. The court has mandated the Union Government to offer logistical support for his possible hospitalization amidst rising tensions.

Dallewal, who is battling cancer, has been on a fast-unto-death since November 26, demanding the government provide statutory guarantees for Minimum Support Prices. The court will further review the situation on December 31.

  • The Supreme Court has recorded dissatisfaction with Punjab's report on Dallewal's health.
  • Dallewal's health is reportedly deteriorating as he remains on a hunger strike.
  • The state claims there could be 'collateral damage' if Dallewal is forcibly removed for medical treatment.
  • Justice Kant criticized the current situation, questioning the motives of farmers' leaders.
  • The Punjab government and police are under scrutiny for their handling of the protests surrounding Dallewal.
“This is actually abetment to suicide... You first create a problem and then take a plea.” - Justice Dhulia

The situation is critical and highlights broader discussions about farmers' rights and governmental responsibilities in health emergencies.

item.title: BREAKING | Madras High Court Forms SIT To Investigate The Alleged Sexual Assault Of Student In Anna... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Madras High Court Forms Special Investigation Team for Assault Case

Publication Date: December 28, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Madras High Court has established a Special Investigation Team (SIT) comprising women IPS officers to probe the alleged sexual assault of a 2nd Year Engineering student at Anna University in Chennai.

  • The court emphasized that there were lapses by the police and the University.
  • An interim compensation of Rs. 25 Lakh was ordered for the victim.
  • Anna University is to provide counseling and waive all fees for the victim.
  • The court condemned a police commissioner's press meeting discussing the case without prior government sanction.
  • The FIR was criticized for being insensitively worded, contributing to victim-blaming.
“Women have always been punished for the crimes against them. Society should be ashamed of blaming women. Why can't a woman wish to walk around freely at night... The perpetrators benefit from victim shaming and victim blaming,” the court stated.

This ruling aims to ensure justice for the victim and accountability for those responsible for the lapses in handling the case.

item.title: Madras High Court orders SIT probe into Anna University sexual assault, directs ₹25 lakh compensation for victim - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Madras High Court Orders SIT Probe into Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Published on: 28 Dec 2024, 7:47 am, Source: Unknown

The Madras High Court has directed a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate the sexual assault of a 19-year-old student from Anna University, amidst concerns of police negligence in handling the case.

  • The Court ordered an interim compensation of ₹25 lakh to the victim.
  • Police are instructed to provide protection to the victim and her family.
  • A SIT will be formed with three Indian Police Service officers due to the ongoing investigation's shortcomings.
  • The High Court condemned the victim-blaming language in the First Information Report (FIR).
  • The Court highlighted the need to protect women's rights and dignity.
"The deplorable language of the FIR paves the way for victim blaming. It is shocking."

In conclusion, the Court emphasized that the society must work towards protecting women and ensuring that they do not face judgment based on their gender.

item.title: Supreme Court livid after Punjab says "helpless" to provide medical aid to Jagjit Dallewal - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court livid after Punjab says "helpless" to provide medical aid to Jagjit Dallewal

Published on: 28 Dec 2024, 7:28 am

The Supreme Court expressed strong discontent regarding the Punjab government's claim of being unable to provide medical aid to Jagjit Singh Dallewal, a farmer's leader on a hunger strike, amidst ongoing protests.

  • The Punjab government argued that other protesting farmers were obstructing their attempts to grant medical aid.
  • The Supreme Court reiterated that Punjab must comply with previous orders to provide necessary medical assistance.
  • The Court provided additional time for the State to comply with its directions, suggesting assistance from the Central government if needed.
  • The Court heard a contempt petition against the Chief Secretary for not complying with an order requiring Dallewal’s hospitalisation.
  • Justice Kant criticized the farmers for preventing medical aid, labeling such actions as unacceptable.
“When you (eventually) give him some aid, it may be too little too late.” — Justice Dhulia

The Court emphasized strict adherence to its orders and scheduled the next hearing for December 31.

item.title: NDA created 'unnecessary controversy' over Manmohan Singh's cremation, memorial: Ashok Gehlot - The Hindu
item.description:
Gehlot Accuses NDA of Controversy Over Manmohan Singh's Memorial

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Ashok Gehlot, former Rajasthan chief minister, criticized the NDA government for creating unnecessary controversy surrounding the cremation and memorial of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Gehlot claims public pressure led to BJP's plans for a future memorial for Singh.
  • Manmohan Singh, the architect of India's economic reforms, passed away at 92.
  • Gehlot highlighted inconsistencies in how the BJP has handled tributes to leaders from different parties.
  • Singh's last rites were conducted at Nigam Bodh Ghat, a location Gehlot argues is not special enough for a leader of Singh's stature.
“The NDA government has created an unnecessary controversy over the cremation and memorial of a great personality like Dr Manmohan Singh.” - Ashok Gehlot

In summary, Gehlot's comments reflect broader concerns about the treatment of prominent political figures and the legacy of Singh's contributions to India.
